text:
Typically, the firm's executives (most-senior managers) serve on the board of directors,
along with directors who are not otherwise employed by the firm. In a one-tier board
structure, both company executives and non-executive board members serve on a single
board of directors. In some countries, boards have a two-tier structure in which the
non-executive board members serve on a supervisory board that oversees a management
board, made up of company executives.
